method.name: GET
method.doc: To view the packet tracing status, issue an HTTP GET command on the packet tracing resource URI.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

response.doc: 200 OK Content-Type:application/json { "enabled":false, "status":[ {"name":"State","value":"not running"}, {"name":"Filter Rule","value":"tcp"}, {"name":"Max File Size (kilobytes)","value":"1024"}, {"name":"File Size (kilobytes)","value":"11"}, {"name":"Packet Count","value":"52"}, {"name":"Time of First Packet","value":"Thu Aug 16 02:11:41 2018"}, {"name":"Time of Last Packet","value":"Thu Aug 16 02:12:51 2018"}, {"name":"Average Packet Size (bytes)","value":"186"}, {"name":"Average Packet Rate (packets/sec)","value":"0"} ], "files":[ { "name": "trace03.pcap", "details": [ {"name": "File Size (kilobytes)","value": "11"},

param.name: enabled
param.doc: A boolean that indicates whether packet tracing is enabled.

param.name: status
param.doc: An array of name-value pairs that represents the status. Note that the file specific values reference the current trace file only. The details for all files are included in the files array.

param.name: files
param.doc: An array containing the details for each trace file (including rollover files).

param.name: name
param.doc: The name of an attribute of the packet tracing status (e.g. State, Interface, Filter Rule)

param.name: value
param.doc: The value held by an attribute of the packet tracing status (e.g. running, 1.1, tcp)

param.name: name
param.doc: The name of the trace file.

param.name: details
param.doc: An array of name-value pairs that represents the details of the file.

response.doc: There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.
File not Found, The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.
An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.
